qas.question: What "Arsenal" was Detroit a part of ?
What nickname for Detroit recognizes it's musical history?
Which hockey team is based in Detroit?
What Kiss song gave Detroit the nickname Rock City?

context: Known as the world's automotive center, "Detroit" is a metonym for that industry. Detroit's auto industry, some of which was converted to wartime defense production, was an important element of the American "<a0_0>Arsenal of Democracy<a0_0/>" supporting the Allied powers during World War II. It is an important source of popular music legacies celebrated by the city's two familiar nicknames, the Motor City and <a1_0>Motown<a1_0/>. Other nicknames arose in the 20th century, including City of Champions, beginning in the 1930s for its successes in individual and team sport; The D; Hockeytown (a trademark owned by the city's NHL club, the <a3_0>Red Wings<a3_0/>); Rock City (after the Kiss song "<a4_0>Detroit Rock City<a4_0/>"); and The <a2_0>313<a2_0/> (its telephone area code).
